revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Microsoft |model=MN-700 |revision=(3.0) |upc=805529291836 |asin=B0000BZO58 |manuf_country=Taiwan |is_manuf=No |manuf=Accton |manuf_model=WG4005 |manuf_rev=-68 (CM) |availability=EoL |est_release_date=08/06/2003 |fcc_date=06/30/2003 |fcc_id=C3KMN700, C3KMN730 |ic_id=3048A-MN700 |pcb_id=141400520001J |type=wireless router |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=barrel, reverse gender core |pwr_pol=reverse |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM4702;BCM4702KPB, CA0319 P10, 72877A J; |cpu1_cspeed=125 |fla1=4 MiB |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model= |ram1=16 MiB |ram1_brand=Micron |ram1_model=MT48LC4M32B2 |expansion_if_types=Mini PCI |expansion_minipci_num=1 |jtag=yes,, 12-pin header,, unpopulated,, J10 |serial=possible,, 10-pin header,, no UART,, unpopulated,, J8 |wi1_module=Broadcom BCM94306MP |wi1_module_if=Mini PCI |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4306;BCM4306KFB, HS0331 P20, 703693 E; |wi1_chip2_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip2_model=BCM2050;BCM2050KML, TC0333 P11, 703779; |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn=none |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip2_brand=Altima |eth_chip2_model=AC101L;AC101LKQT, TD0329 P11, 702256A |sw_brand=Broadcom |sw_model=BCM5325A2;BCM5325A2KQM, RD0331 P12, 703854; |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_speed=100M |wan_ports=1 |802dot11_protocols=bg |addl_chips=2.4GHz Power Amplifier IC;Micro Mobio;MMPA2406;2406, B11F;1; |flags=Windows CE |stock_os=Windows CE;NET 4.2; |tp_firmware=Oleg (wl500g), OpenWrt, Tomato, DD-WRT |default_ssid=MSHOME |default_ssid_regex=^MSHOME$ |default_ip=192.168.2.1 |default_pass=admin |oui=00:0D:3A |oui_eth=00:0D:3A }} {{TagLine|Microsoft Broadband Networking Wireless Base Station}}
For one particular production model MN-700... *"MN-700", "REV 3.0", "(C) 2003 MICROSOFT CORPORATION", and :"P/N: 141400520001J REV: 01" is silkscreened onto the top of the board. *"MN-700" and "111362-30" is etched onto the bottom of the board. *While there is a clearly marked '''UART''' header, the UART and assoc. :components are all omitted. It's presumed to be usable if populated. <small>Hopefully..</small>
===Links=== *[https://wl500g.info/showthread.php?1616-Microsoft-MN700-hack-project ''Microsoft MN700 hack project'' on '''wl500g.info'''] *[http://web.archive.org/web/20090309201051/http://wl500g.info/showthread.php?t=1616 ''MN700 internals'' on '''wl500g.info'''] ''(via archive.org)'' *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/MN-700 ''Microsoft MN700'' support on the '''DD-WRT''' Wiki] :This unit by default runs WinCE. To install DD-WRT (or any third party Linux :firmware), the bootloader must be replaced.. which will require JTAG access.
===See also=== *[[Microsoft MN-100]] *[[Microsoft MN-500]] *[[Microsoft MN-700]] :*[[ASUS WL-500g]] *[[Microsoft MN-730]]
